content.text: HTML Form Attributes
This chapter describes the different attributes for the HTML <form> element.
content.html: This chapter describes the different attributes for the HTML <form> element.

content.text: The Action Attribute
The action attribute defines the action to be performed when the form is submitted.
content.html: The action attribute defines the action to be performed when the form is submitted.

content.text: Usually, the form data is sent to a file on the server when the user clicks on the submit button.
content.html: Usually, the form data is sent to a file on the server when the user clicks on the submit button.

content.text: In the example below, the form data is sent to a file called "action_page.php". This file contains a server-side script that handles the form data:
content.html: In the example below, the form data is sent to a file called "action_page.php". This file contains a server-side script that handles the form data:

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php">
  <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" value="John"><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname" value="Doe"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
</form>

content.text: Tip: If the action attribute is omitted, the action is set to the current page.
content.html: Tip: If the action attribute is omitted, the action is set to the current page.

content.text: The Target Attribute
The target attribute specifies where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.
content.html: The target attribute specifies where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.

content.text: The target attribute can have one of the following values:
content.html: The target attribute can have one of the following values:

content.code_html:
Value Description
_blank The response is displayed in a new window or tab
_self The response is displayed in the current window
_parent The response is displayed in the parent frame
_top The response is displayed in the full body of the window
framename The response is displayed in a named iframe

content.text: The default value is _self which means that the response will open in the current window.
content.html: The default value is _self which means that the response will open in the current window.

content.code_html: <form action="/action_page.php" target="_blank">

content.text: The Method Attribute
The method attribute specifies the HTTP method to be used when submitting the form data.
content.html: The method attribute specifies the HTTP method to be used when submitting the form data.

content.text: The form-data can be sent as URL variables (with method="get" ) or as HTTP post transaction (with method="post" ).
content.html: The form-data can be sent as URL variables (with method="get") or as HTTP post transaction (with method="post").

content.text: The default HTTP method when submitting form data is GET.
content.html: The default HTTP method when submitting form data is GET.

content.code_html: <form action="/action_page.php" method="get">
<form action="/action_page.php" method="post">

content.text: Notes on GET:
content.html: Notes on GET:

content.text: Notes on POST:
content.html: Notes on POST:

content.text: Tip: Always use POST if the form data contains sensitive or personal information!
content.html: Tip: Always use POST if the form data contains sensitive or personal information!

content.text: The Autocomplete Attribute
The autocomplete attribute specifies whether a form should have autocomplete on or off.
content.html: The autocomplete attribute specifies whether a form should have autocomplete on or off.

content.text: When autocomplete is on, the browser automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before.
content.html: When autocomplete is on, the browser automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before.

content.code_html: <form action="/action_page.php" autocomplete="on">

content.text: The Novalidate Attribute
The novalidate attribute is a boolean attribute.
content.html: The novalidate attribute is a boolean attribute.

content.text: When present, it specifies that the form-data (input) should not be validated when submitted.
content.html: When present, it specifies that the form-data (input) should not be validated when submitted.

content.code_html: <form action="/action_page.php" novalidate>

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct syntax for opening the form's result in a new browser tab?
content.html: What is the correct syntax for opening the form's result in a new browser tab?
